name: Yondu
headline: Robots to Automate Fulfillment
description: Yondu is creating the robotic workforce of the future starting with logistics automation. We're deploying humanoid robots in the first flexible, drop-in picking automation solution designed for 3PLs.

founders.name: Michael Chen, Founder
founders.description: Michael Chen is at a unique crossroads with a background in intelligent machines from MIT and research experience at the forefront of robotics and AI. He helped build an open source bipedal robot at MIT CSAIL. Michael is an avid entrepreneur who has always loved business (even owning a sauce brand). For fun, he builds all sorts of cool machines ranging from FPV drones to train track cleaning robots to gasoline powered snowboards.

founders.name: Tahmid Jamal, Founder
founders.description: Tahmid graduated from MIT with degrees in AI and AeroAstro. There he's worked on projects ranging from language model compression and quantization to astrodynamics simulations for a decadal solar research proposal to NASA. He was doing his master's researching uncertainty estimation methods in deep learning before dropping out to participate in YC. In his free time, he enjoys movies, board games, and climbing the occasional tree.

generated_description:
### Yondu: The Future of Fulfillment Automation

**Founded:** 2024  
**Location:** Los Angeles, CA  
**Team Size:** 3 employees  
**Y Combinator Batch:** W24  
**Mission:** Robots to Automate Fulfillment  

---

**About Yondu**

At Yondu, the vision is clear: create a robotic workforce that reshapes logistics as we know it. Starting with the deployment of humanoid robots, Yondu is pioneering what they call a "flexible, drop-in picking automation solution." This innovative approach is aimed at third-party logistics providers (3PLs), essentially changing how goods are picked and packed.

Being part of the prestigious Y Combinator network has positioned Yondu to innovate aggressively in the realms of robotics and logistics. They are laser-focused on harnessing the power of artificial intelligence and hard-tech to drive efficiency in environments like grocery stores and warehouses.

**What They Do**

Yondu is not just about creating robots; it's about revolutionizing the fulfillment process. Their technology promises to boost efficiency across various applications, especially within the logistics sector. From automating grocery deliveries to streamlining warehouse operations, Yondu aims to take the grunt work out of fulfillment and make it more intelligent.

They’re currently engaged in:

- **Grocery Solutions:** Leveraging robots to automate picking in grocery stores.
- **Warehousing:** Introducing advanced automation to enhance operational efficiency in warehouses.
  
You can learn more about their applications and insights by visiting their [website](https://yondu.ai/) or exploring their [blog](https://yondu.ai/</blog>).

**Key Figures**

- **Diana Hu:** Group Partner and an integral part of the Yondu team.

**Interests & Tags**

Yondu has positioned itself at the intersection of several exciting fields:  
- **Artificial Intelligence**
- **Hard Tech**
- **Robotics**
- **Logistics**

In summary, Yondu is a bold venture riding the wave of automation, ready to redefine fulfillment logistics. With a dedicated team and backing from Y Combinator, they stand at the forefront of a burgeoning industry, committed to "automating the future, one pick at a time." 

For regular updates and insights, you can follow them on [LinkedIn](https://yondu.ai/<https:/www.linkedin.com/company/yonduai/>) and [Twitter](https://yondu.ai/<https:/twitter.com/yonduai>). 

If you're interested in the future of logistics, keep an eye on Yondu—it's bound to be exciting!
